author: Susheel Varma <susheel.varma@sheffield.ac.uk>
description: Transforms an image to an output image whilst applying the specified transforms.

operations.description: Returns attributes of external source image

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The source url of the image to identify. Eg. lob://public/Lenna.png. Supports HTTP and LOB URLs to 'jpg', 'jpe', 'jpeg', 'png', 'svg', 'bmp', 'tif' filetypes.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify the format of the response. Supports an xml or json metadata response. Default: json.

operations.description: Returns attributes of an uploaded image

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The image to be uploaded for identification. Supported filetypes - 'jpg', 'jpe', 'jpeg', 'png', 'svg', 'bmp', 'tif'.

parameters.name: dest
parameters.description: LOBCDER destination path. Eg. lob://public/Lenna.png. Note: Using this parameter breaks the RESTful idempotent nature of this method as it returns the attributes of a POSTed file. Ideally you would perform the same operation using a seperate POST to upload the file and then GET the file back.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Specify the format of the response. Supports an xml or json metadata response. Default: json.

operations.description: Returns a transformed external source image

parameters.name: src
parameters.description: The source url of the image to convert. Eg. lob://public/Lenna.png. Supports HTTP and LOB URLs to 'jpg', 'jpe', 'jpeg', 'png', 'svg', 'bmp', 'tif' filetypes.

parameters.name: flip
parameters.description: Applies a mirror transform along the vertical or horizontal direction. Supports 'V'(vertical) or 'H'(horizontal).

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Converts image into specified format. Supports jpg, tif, png.

parameters.name: resize
parameters.description: Resizes the image specified in 'WxH' format. where W and H are pixel dimensions and are separated by an 'x' (e.g., '75x200')

parameters.name: rotate
parameters.description: Rotates the image specified in 'D' format, where D is between -360.0 and 360.0 except 0.
